articles.title: “The Most Dramatic Evolutionary Biogeography Story I've Ever Seen” – Plant Fossils Reveal Ancient South America-to-Asia “Escape Route” - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Newly discovered fossils in Argentina provide evidence that changes in climate and geography may have compelled a well-known species of spurge plants to migrate from southern South America to southeast Asia and beyond. Those who have embarked on extended jour…
articles.content:
ByPenn StateJuly 30, 2023
A compound infructescence fossil showing preserved fruits and seeds attached to branches. The 52-million-year-old fossil fruits and leaves that the researchers identified a… [+8847 chars]

articles.title: Scientists discover 'more than 50% complete' skeleton of new dinosaur in Thailand - KCENNews
articles.description: The scientists said the skeleton of minimocursor phunoiensis is "one of the best-preserved dinosaurs ever found in Southeast Asia".Read more: https://www.kce...
